comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11

When multiple items selected in the history, the middle-click mouse no longer works in 2.0.11.  This functionality works great in older SeaMonkey browsers.  If only one item is selected, the middle-click works as expected.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.upgrade to or install new for 2.0.10
2.ctrl-h
3.use the shift key
4.press the mouse wheel and see nothing happens
Actual Results:  
I have repeated the Steps to Reproduce with the same results

Expected Results:  
In previous SaeMonkey versions, if I selected three history items, I would see three new tabs appear in the browing window.

If I go back to older versions, this works great.  Also, if I right-click on the multiple select history items, there is a menu item for "open in new tab".  Selecting this menu item works as expected, for an optional work around.  This appears to be an issue unrelated to bookmarks.
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.0; en-US; rv:1.9.1.16) Gecko/20101123 SeaMonkey/2.0.11

When multiple items selected in the history, the middle-click mouse no longer works in 2.0.11.  This functionality works great in older SeaMonkey browsers.  If only one item is selected, the middle-click works as expected.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.upgrade to or install new for 2.0.10
2.ctrl-h
3.use the shift key
4.press the mouse wheel and see nothing happens
Actual Results:  
I have repeated the Steps to Reproduce with the same results

Expected Results:  
In previous SaeMonkey versions, if I selected three history items, I would see three new tabs appear in the browing window.

If I go back to older versions, this works great.  Also, if I right-click on the multiple select history items, there is a menu item for "open in new tab".  Selecting this menu item works as expected, for an optional work around.  This appears to be an issue unrelated to bookmarks.
comments.creator: me@sharktooth.org
